intro: Melandrium macrorhizum, commonly known as the broadroot catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a robust root system, which allows it to thrive in a variety of soil types, including sandy and clay soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Melandrium macrorhizum is typically found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides, fields, and waste areas.
